data.title: The Most Affluent Zip Code in Every State in America
data.meta_description: Take a tour on some of the most opulent neighborhoods in each state, plus D.C.
data.text:
From exclusive amenities to simple prestige, people will pay a premium to make an affluent area their home.

Zip codes are an easy way to zero in on America's most expensive addresses.

Data used in this zip code analysis, below, were compiled using September 2020's Zillow Home Value Index and only zip codes with such available data were included.

Construction Coverage studied the mammoth data set to find the zip code areas with the highest average home price for every U.S. state, plus the District of Columbia.

Michael LaFirenza from the sitetold Newsweek: "Many of the nation's most expensive zip codes are located just outside of major urban areas, which, given shifting preferences among home buyers in the wake of COVID-19, experienced dramatic price increases this past year.

"However, as vaccination rates rise and residents become more comfortable with urban life again, we can expect many of these suburban markets to cool down looking ahead."

Take a look through the list...

Alabama

Fairhope is a vibrant town on Alabama's Gulf Coast recognised for its lovely parks and its panoramic views of Mobile Bay.

Most affluent zip code: 36564

City: Fairhope. Metro: Daphne-Fairhope-Foley

Zip code average home price: $616,543

Alaska

Anchorage combines wild Alaska beauty with the convenience of modern-day urban comfort.

Most affluent zip code: 99516

City / Metro: Anchorage

Zip code average home price: $489,476

Arizona

This study has discovered some of the lowest median home prices can be found in this state.

Most affluent zip code: 85253

City: Paradise Valley. Metro: Phoenix-Mesa-Scottsdale

Zip code average home price: $1,738,918

State average home price: $295,462

Arkansas

This state also contains some of America's lowest median home prices.

Most affluent zip code: 72223

City: Little Rock. Metro: Little Rock-North Little Rock-Conway

Zip code average home price: $345,799

State average home price: $134,987

California

At the state level, some of America's highest median home prices can be found in California.

Most affluent zip code: 94027

City: Atherton. Metro: San Francisco-Oakland-Hayward

Zip code average home price: $6,444,729

State average home price: $589,675

Colorado

Aspen is a ski resort town situated in the heart of the White River National Forest, as famed for its outdoor recreation as for it exclusive restaurants and boutiques.

Most affluent zip code: 81656

City: Aspen. Metro: Glenwood Springs

Zip code average home price: $2,807,116

State average home price: $425,531

Difference between zip code and state price: 6.6X

Connecticut

Connecticut is the third smallest state by area, the 29th most populous, making it the fourth most densely populated of the fifty U.S. states.

Most affluent zip code: 06830

City: Greenwich. Metro: Bridgeport-Stamford-Norwalk

Zip code average home price: $1,540,123

State average home price: $282,098

Delaware

Sitting on Connecticut's Gold Coast, the exclusive town Greenwich is well-known as one of America's richest.

Most affluent zip code: 19944

City: Fenwick Island. Metro: Salisbury

Zip code average home price: $912,876

State average home price: $270,434

Those moving to this area can expect to benefit from access to historic national monuments and famous museums.

Most affluent zip code: 20052

City / Metro: Washington / Arlington-Alexandria

City: Fisher Island. Metro: Fort Lauderdale / West Palm Beach

State average home price: $268,442

City: Sea Island. Metro: Brunswick

Some of America's highest median home prices are found in Hawaii.

The highest median U.S. home prices are found in the state of Massachusetts.

Some of lowest median home prices can be found in this state.

Most affluent zip code: 39110

Metro / City: Jackson

City: Ladue. Metro: St. Louis

This area of Nebraska is an excellent blend of the charming and modern.

Some of the lowest median home prices are located in Oklahoma.

This historic area with a rich history retains ample entertainment.

This exclusive area in Utah is very popular with celebrities for its for winter activities.

This U.S. state contains some of America's highest average house prices.

Some of the lowest average house prices can be found in this U.S. state.
